quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Season and Stanley Cup
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, child, champion. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who were the Stanley Cup champions for the 1994-1995 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey Devils

questions.question: The 2006-2007 NHL Stanley Cup Finals were won by this team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anaheim Ducks

questions.question: Who won the NHLs holy grail for the 2000-2001 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colorado Avalanche

questions.question: Which team captured the NHL title and the coveted Stanley Cup for the 1997-1998 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Red Wings

questions.question: Who won the Stanley Cup for the 2004-2005 NHL season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Who was the NHL Stanley Cup winner for 1996-1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Red Wings

questions.question: The Stanley Cup went to this team following the 2001-2002 season.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Detroit Red Wings

questions.question: Who was the Stanley Cup champion following the 2003-2004 NHL season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tampa Bay Lightning

questions.question: Which of these horses is not a child of  thoroughbred race horse, Seabiscuit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea Orbit

questions.question: Who got to take the Stanley Cup home to their families following the 2002-2003 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey Devils

questions.question: Which team won the Stanley Cup following the 1999-2000 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey Devils

questions.question: Who was the Stanley Cup champion in 1998-1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Stars

questions.question: Who won the Stanley Cup at the end of the 1993-1994 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York Rangers

questions.question: Who was the Stanley Cup winner for 2005-2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carolina Hurricanes

questions.question: Who sipped from the Stanley Cup following the 1995-1996 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colorado Avalanche

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Ball and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, coin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: You mark your golf ball on the green with a coin, but when you return the ball to its spot, you realize you stepped on the coin and its now stuck to your shoe. What should you do?

options.text: Take a 2-stroke penalty and replace your marker
Pretend that nothing happened any quickly toss the coin down so your partners dont suspect foul
Add 1 stroke to your score and replace it as near as possible to its original position
Replace the marker as close as possible to the original location without penalty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Add 1 stroke to your score and replace it as near as possible to its original position

questions.question: Of all the great players’ numbers retired by the Montreal Canadiens, one number has actually been retired more than once. Which number is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12

questions.question: Who was the trainer of thoroughbred race horse, Seabiscuit, that rarely spoke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Smith

questions.question: After marking their ball on the green, a golf player tosses it to their caddie to clean. Thanks to the caddies excellent hand-eye coordination, he dropped it and the ball rolled into a lake. How should the player proceed?

options.text: Either retrieve the ball from the lake and play on or take a 1 stroke penalty and continue the hole with a new ball
Either retrieve the ball from the lake and play on or take a 2 stroke penalty and continue the hole with a new ball
Continue the hole with a new ball for no penalty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Either retrieve the ball from the lake and play on or take a 2 stroke penalty and continue the hole with a new ball

questions.question: Barbaro went into the Kentucky Derby undefeated at 5-0.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: A golf ball embeds into the side of the hole. How should the player who hit it proceed?

options.text: Replay the shot for no penalty
Play the ball as it lies
Place the ball on the nearest edge of the hole and play from there

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Place the ball on the nearest edge of the hole and play from there

questions.question: Montreal Canadiens Head Coach Guy Carbonneau was once a Habs player. What year was he traded and to which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1994 to the St-Louis Blues

questions.question: You hit your tee shot deep into the woods, where it might be lost. You announce that youll play a provisional and immediately hit before your playing partner. Your buddy says you should be penalized for playing out of turn. What should you do according to golf rules?

options.text: Take no penalty but replay your provisional in order
Take no penalty because you were not going out of order to give one player an advantage
Take a 1-stroke penalty for not waiting for all other playing partners to hit before taking a provisional

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Take no penalty because you were not going out of order to give one player an advantage

questions.question: After playing an approach shot into the green, you find that some prankster in the group ahead had jammed the flag some 40 feet from where the actual golf hole was. How do you proceed?

options.text: Play the ball as it lies
Move the ball to the same distance from the hole as it was with the fake hole

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Play the ball as it lies

questions.question: As you are making an attempt to strike the golf ball, the head of the club separates from the shaft on your backswing. You complete the swing but miss the ball. Did you make a stroke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: A golf player addresses their ball and is half way through their backswing when a gust of wind rolled the ball back an inch. What is the ruling?

options.text: The player takes one penalty stroke and replaces the ball.
The player should take no penalty but replay the shot.
The player takes one penalty stroke and plays the ball as it lies.
Since Mother Nature is to blame for the movement, there is no penalty and the player now plays the ball as it lies.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The player takes one penalty stroke and plays the ball as it lies.

questions.question: There is no greater honour for a professional athlete to have his number retired by the franchise for which he used to play. Prior to the 2007-2008 season, how many retired numbers were there in the Montreal Canadiens hockey team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11

questions.question: The Hockey Hall of Fame located in Toronto, Ontario, has inducted some of the greatest of hockey players over the years. Which member of the Montreal Canadiens was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The 44th

questions.question: Golf player A tees off, he mutters a few f-bombs as he watches his ball fly far right into trees and says, Ill play another one. Then he re-tees another ball. His 2nd ball is straighter - in the fairway. Player B claims foul as he did not say he was playing a provisional ball, using those exact words. What should then be done?

options.text: Player A is disqualified for swearing.
Player A is disqualified for illegally playing a shot.
Player A and B both decide that it was meant as a provisional and thus Player A plays his 3rd shot from the fairway using his 2nd ball.
Player B is disqualified for accusing his partner for cheating.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Player A is disqualified for illegally playing a shot.

questions.question: In what season did the Montreal Canadiens win their first Stanley Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1915-1916

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: New York Rangers and Coach
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, playoffs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the honour

questions.question: In what year did Glen Sather become President and GM of the New York Rangers?

questions.question: Before the 2009 playoffs began, New York Rangers head coach Tom Renney and this assistant coach were fired.

questions.question: In the 1993 playoffs the New York Rangers beat the New Jersey Devils in 7 games in the Conference finals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This former ice hockey defenseman, born in Ontario, Canada, played 465 games as a New York Ranger and wore number 2.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brad Park

questions.question: Tiger Woods was the highest-paid professional athlete in 2008.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The 2009 US Open Golf Championship was played at Bethpage Black. What was its par?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 70

questions.question: What golf term refers to a score of a 3 on a par 5?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eagle

questions.question: In 2009, Tom Renney, ex-head coach of the New York Rangers, became the new assistant coach of what team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmonton Oilers

questions.question: In 2009, New York Rangers defenseman Michal Rozsíval switched to this number.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 33

questions.question: Denim clothing is acceptable on most golf courses around the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following New York Rangers retired after the 2008-09 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Markus Naslund

questions.question: The Open Championship was first played on 17 October 1860 at this golf course.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prestwick

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Year and Players
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, kind, stadium. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Until 2008, only three Spanish players made it to the finals of the US Open. Manuel Santana and Manuel Orantes lifted the trophy in 1965 and 1975, respectively. Who stayed runner-up in the 2003 final?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juan Carlos Ferrero

questions.question: How many times did Roger Federer defeat an American player in the final during his successive five championship wins (2004-2008)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: What tennis player won the US Open in 1990, becoming the youngest ever US Open champion in mens singles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Sampras

questions.question: It is generally agreed that riding on off-road paths is safer than riding on the street.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did Bob and Mike Bryan win the US Open doubles final for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2005

questions.question: In what year did Tiger Woods win the US Open Championship held at Torrey Pines?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2008

questions.question: The US Open Tennis Championships were first contested in 1881 as the US National Championships. What events did the players compete in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: mens singles

questions.question: In the 2002 mixed doubles US Open final, Bob Bryan, partnering with Lisa Raymond won the title, beating his brother Mike on the opposite side.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which country won the maximum number of US Open championships since the beginning of the Open Era in 1968 until 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: The production of the worlds first commercially available bicycles began in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1867

questions.question: What kind of handlebar would you normally find on a road bike?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drop handlebar

questions.question: The Arthur Ashe Stadium is named after Arthur Ashe, the African-American tennis player.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The US Open was originally played on grass and clay courts before moving to acrylic hard court.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the players who have won five US Open titles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John McEnroe

questions.question: In what year did Specialized Bicycle Components produce the first mountain bike called the Stumpjumper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1982

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Opening and Defense
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, opening, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This defense to the first move P-K4 involves the move P-QB3. It is considered solid, and was a favorite of world champion Anatoly Karpov.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caro-Kann Defense

questions.question: The Fischer Defense to the Kings Gambit involves which of the following moves by black?

options.text: P-Q4, N-KB3, and in some cases QxP

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P-Q3, P-KN4, P-KR3, B-KN2

questions.question: This defense to the first move P-K4 involves the move P-K3. It is a very difficult opening to play and was a favorite of Victor Korchnoi.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The French Defense

questions.question: Fat Tire Week takes place in what town in the state of Colorado?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crested Butte

questions.question: What is the name of the mechanism at the bottom of pro-cyclists shoes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleats

questions.question: This chess opening involves the move P-KB4 (f4) by white, and often the fianchetto of the queens bishop.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Birds Opening

questions.question: What world famous trail is located near Moab, Utah?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slickrock Bike Trail

questions.question: This chess opening was named after a mythical creature.

options.text: The Dragon Variation of the Sicilian Defense
The Phoenix Variation of the Trompowsky Attack
The Unicorn Variation of the Kings Gambit
The Centaur Variation of the Queens Gambit

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dragon Variation of the Sicilian Defense

questions.question: This chess opening involves up to 3 knight moves in succession before any other piece or pawn is moved.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alekhine

questions.question: There are open, semi-open and closed openings. Which of the following openings would be considered an open game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Two Knights Defense

questions.question: Looking to expand the alternatives for Bike to Work Day, Jeff Obst coined the phrase B-BOP (Bike, Bus, Or carPool) Day. In what year was this campaign initiated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1991

questions.question: The first world champion, Steinitz lost many games against this opening which involves the moves 1 P-K4 P-K4 2 N-KB3 N-QB3 3 B-B4 B-B4 4 P-QN4.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evans Gambit

questions.question: The first move by white 1 N-KB3 could result in all of the following openings except which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kings Gambit

questions.question: This chess opening involves no pawn moves beyond the third rank.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hedgehog Defense

questions.question: Which of the following is a Hypermodern opening?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: English Opening

questions.question: In lacrosse, a slash is a 30-second penalty.
